main event: Lights were observed for about 1-2 minutes in Englewood Hills, Ohio on September 8, 1961, disappearing both in the same manner. The same lights were viewed all last week.
interesting points: The lights were described as changing in brightness.
The sighting was not considered unusual by the witness.
The witness was observing some object all that time.
The witness could not provide an estimate of the speed or distance of the object.
The sighting occurred in a rural area, not near an airfield.
result: Possible balloon, not an unusual sighting
